body.p:
"Lebanon
Democrat"
March 7th
Harrodsburg KY ^Feby.^ 9th
Dear Gov,

I send you above a slip from Andy Barnett's paper of today, No one here has access to the journals and I hope Tom Monroe will do me the favor to set me right, He can say that if the Editor of the Demct had taken the trouble to consult the representative from Marion who sat immediately upon
the right of the from Mercer ^he would have learned^ that when the bill first passed the House (without a division) Dr Abell voted no, and if he consults the journal he will find that upon its final passage after the bill had been returned with the objections of the Governor he also voted no,

Pardon me for dis troubling you with this but I don't know where a citizen would reach the Editor of the "Statesman" and I am desiring of having the correction made at once
for reasons that are sufficiently apparent,
I have yet to meet with the first man who does not approve the veto. I consider it highly as perfectly inconsiderable,

In Yours
Most Truly
C S Abell

C. S. Abell
Refer to Editor Yeoman --
